name: iter::adapters::map_windows::MapWindows::<I, F, N>::new

fmt::Arguments::<'a>::from_str.doc:
Create a `fmt::Arguments` object for a single static string.

 Formatting this `fmt::Arguments` will just produce the string as-is.

panicking::panic_fmt.doc:
The entry point for panicking with a formatted message.

 This is designed to reduce the amount of code required at the call
 site as much as possible (so that `panic!()` has as low an impact
 on (e.g.) the inlining of other functions as possible), by moving
 the actual formatting into this shared place.

num::<impl usize>::checked_mul.doc:
Checked integer multiplication. Computes `self * rhs`, returning
 `None` if overflow occurred.

 # Examples

 ```
 ```
